11namespace v8::internal::compiler::turboshaft {
12
13const TSCallDescriptor* CreateAllocateBuiltinDescriptor(Zone* zone,
14 Isolate* isolate) {
15 return TSCallDescriptor::Create(
16 Linkage::GetStubCallDescriptor(
17 zone, AllocateDescriptor{},
18 AllocateDescriptor{}.GetStackParameterCount(),
19 CallDescriptor::kCanUseRoots, Operator::kNoThrow,
20 isolate != nullptr ? StubCallMode::kCallCodeObject
21 : StubCallMode::kCallBuiltinPointer),
22 CanThrow::kNo, zone);
23}
24
25void MemoryAnalyzer::Run() {
26 block_states[current_block] = BlockState{};
27 BlockIndex end = BlockIndex(input_graph.block_count());
28 while (current_block < end) {
29 state = *block_states[current_block];
30 auto operations_range =
31 input_graph.operations(input_graph.Get(current_block));
32 // Set the next block index here already, to allow it to be changed if
33 // needed.
34 current_block = BlockIndex(current_block.id() + 1);
35 for (const Operation& op : operations_range) {
36 Process(op);
37 }
38 }
39}
40
41void MemoryAnalyzer::Process(const Operation& op) {
42 if (ShouldSkipOperation(op)) {
43 return;
44 }
45
46 if (auto* alloc = op.TryCast<AllocateOp>()) {
47 ProcessAllocation(*alloc);
48 return;
49 }
50 if (auto* store = op.TryCast<StoreOp>()) {
51 ProcessStore(*store);
52 return;
53 }
54 if (op.Effects().can_allocate) {
55 state = BlockState();
56 }
57 if (op.IsBlockTerminator()) {
58 ProcessBlockTerminator(op);
59 }
60}
61
62// Update the successor block states based on the state of the current block.
63// For loop backedges, we need to re-start the analysis from the loop header
64// unless the backedge state is unchanged.
65void MemoryAnalyzer::ProcessBlockTerminator(const Operation& op) {
66 if (auto* goto_op = op.TryCast<GotoOp>()) {
67 if (input_graph.IsLoopBackedge(*goto_op)) {
68 base::Optional<BlockState>& target_state =
69 block_states[goto_op->destination->index()];
70 BlockState old_state = *target_state;
71 MergeCurrentStateIntoSuccessor(goto_op->destination);
72 if (old_state != *target_state) {
73 // We can never fold allocations inside of the loop into an
74 // allocation before the loop, since this leads to unbounded
75 // allocation size. An unknown `reserved_size` will prevent adding
76 // allocations inside of the loop.
77 target_state->reserved_size = base::nullopt;
78 // Redo the analysis from the beginning of the loop.
79 current_block = goto_op->destination->index();
80 }
81 return;
82 } else if (goto_op->destination->IsLoop()) {
83 // Look ahead to detect allocating loops earlier, avoiding a wrong
84 // speculation resulting in processing the loop twice.
85 for (const Operation& op :
86 input_graph.operations(*goto_op->destination)) {
87 if (op.Effects().can_allocate && !ShouldSkipOperation(op)) {
88 state = BlockState();
89 break;
90 }
91 }
92 }
93 }
94 for (Block* successor : SuccessorBlocks(op)) {
95 MergeCurrentStateIntoSuccessor(successor);
96 }
97}
98
99// We try to merge the new allocation into a previous dominating allocation.
100// We also allow folding allocations across blocks, as long as there is a
101// dominating relationship.
102void MemoryAnalyzer::ProcessAllocation(const AllocateOp& alloc) {
103 if (ShouldSkipOptimizationStep()) return;
104 base::Optional<uint64_t> new_size;
105 if (auto* size =
106 input_graph.Get(alloc.size()).template TryCast<ConstantOp>()) {
107 new_size = size->integral();
108 }
109 // If the new allocation has a static size and is of the same type, then we
110 // can fold it into the previous allocation unless the folded allocation would
111 // exceed `kMaxRegularHeapObjectSize`.
112 if (allocation_folding == AllocationFolding::kDoAllocationFolding &&
113 state.last_allocation && new_size.has_value() &&
114 state.reserved_size.has_value() &&
115 alloc.type == state.last_allocation->type &&
116 *new_size <= kMaxRegularHeapObjectSize - *state.reserved_size) {
117 state.reserved_size =
118 static_cast<uint32_t>(*state.reserved_size + *new_size);
119 folded_into[&alloc] = state.last_allocation;
120 uint32_t& max_reserved_size = reserved_size[state.last_allocation];
121 max_reserved_size = std::max(max_reserved_size, *state.reserved_size);
122 return;
123 }
124 state.last_allocation = &alloc;
125 state.reserved_size = base::nullopt;
126 if (new_size.has_value() && *new_size <= kMaxRegularHeapObjectSize) {
127 state.reserved_size = static_cast<uint32_t>(*new_size);
128 }
129 // We might be re-visiting the current block. In this case, we need to remove
130 // an allocation that can no longer be folded.
131 reserved_size.erase(&alloc);
132 folded_into.erase(&alloc);
133}
134
135void MemoryAnalyzer::ProcessStore(const StoreOp& store) {
136 OpIndex store_op_index = input_graph.Index(store);
137 if (SkipWriteBarrier(store)) {
138 skipped_write_barriers.insert(store_op_index);
139 } else {
140 // We might be re-visiting the current block. In this case, we need to
141 // still update the information.
142 DCHECK_NE(store.write_barrier, WriteBarrierKind::kAssertNoWriteBarrier);
143 skipped_write_barriers.erase(store_op_index);
144 }
145}
146
147void MemoryAnalyzer::MergeCurrentStateIntoSuccessor(const Block* successor) {
148 base::Optional<BlockState>& target_state = block_states[successor->index()];
149 if (!target_state.has_value()) {
150 target_state = state;
151 return;
152 }
153 // All predecessors need to have the same last allocation for us to continue
154 // folding into it.
155 if (target_state->last_allocation != state.last_allocation) {
156 target_state = BlockState();
157 return;
158 }
159 // We take the maximum allocation size of all predecessors. If the size is
160 // unknown because it is dynamic, we remember the allocation to eliminate
161 // write barriers.
162 if (target_state->reserved_size.has_value() &&
163 state.reserved_size.has_value()) {
164 target_state->reserved_size =
165 std::max(*target_state->reserved_size, *state.reserved_size);
166 } else {
167 target_state->reserved_size = base::nullopt;
168 }
169}
